content:
I've run the tests for devnet-1 with Kurtosis, but when I initially started them I got a lot of errors similar to this one:

```
There was an error validating Starlark code 
Error while validating instruction add_service(name="assertoor", config=ServiceConfig(image="ethpandaops/assertoor:electra-support", ports={"http": PortSpec(number=8080, transport_protocol="TCP", application_protocol="http")}, files={"/config": "assertoor-config", "/tests": "assertoor-tests", "/validator-ranges": "validator-ranges"}, cmd=["--config", "/config/assertoor-config.yaml"], max_cpu=1000, min_cpu=100, max_memory=2048, min_memory=128, node_selectors={})). The instruction can be found at github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package/src/assertoor/assertoor_launcher.star[107:21]
    Caused by: service 'assertoor' requires '128' megabytes of memory but based on our calculation we will only have '4' megabytes available at the time we start the service
```

After removing 2 of the EL and 2 of the CL clients from the config, the tests were running successfully. So are those errors simple caused because I don't have enough memory on my local machine to run the tests with all the clients?

author: parithosh
content: Yeah that's exactly it, you can also override the default memory and reduce it to get more clients to run but we can't guarantee the clients will like it

Oh weird: turns out my issue is somehow IPv6 related?  Seems like `http://localhost:8555` resolves to `[::1]:8555` which fails w/ a `403 Forbidden` but `127.0.0.1:8555` works..
